qas.question: Church and state have been officially separated in Uruguay since what year?
What religion has the most followers in Montevideo?
When was the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Montevideo created?

context: Church and state are officially separated since <a0_0>1916<a0_0/> in Uruguay. The religion with most followers in Montevideo is <a1_0>Roman Catholicism<a1_0/> and has been so since the foundation of the city. The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Montevideo was created as the Apostolic Vicariate of Montevideo in <a2_0>1830<a2_0/>. The vicariate was promoted to the Diocese of Montevideo on 13 July 1878. Pope Leo XIII elevated it to the rank of a metropolitan archdiocese on 14 April 1897. The new archdiocese became the Metropolitan of the suffragan sees of Canelones, Florida, Maldonado–Punta del Este, Melo, Mercedes, Minas, Salto, San José de Mayo, Tacuarembó.
